name: Quest of a New World
description:
This is a very early protopy of a procedurally generated action-dventure 2D game.
Basically every time you play, a world is generated (even though right now the changes aren't that noticeables) and you can play it.

To check controls you can press "Esc". But basically you can use: arrow keys/"wasd" for movement, "q" and "e" for camera movement, "i" for attacks and "z" for actions/skip dialogues/get out of buildings.

This is just a very early prototype, the idea for the game is that every time you start a new game you generate an entire planet-worth of upperworld, it's population and you have a different starting story every time, then you are free to explore the world, interact, do quests,.. for now it's always an island-sized world, with a town and a mine-dungeon, characters colors are randomized, buildings compositions are randomized but that's it. Oh the gameplay it's in a very early stage too.
